result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
15CF293, 15CM143 Defendant Caleb J Spoerl in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller and Jaclyn Shelton.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews amended charge in 15CF293, defendant pleads guilty, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea and finds def guilty, both counts in 15CM143 are DRI, victim heard, defendant's father heard, state heard, exhibits received, defense counsel heard, defendant heard, court heard and sentence imposed. 

15CF293
4 yr IC, 3 yr ES, IMPOSED AND STAYED, concurrent, elgible for substance abuse and ERP
4 years probation
1 yr in DCJ, first 6 mo served forthwith w/huber for treatment only at Dodge County Human Services, may work in the DCJ, last 6 mo imposed and stayed for rule violations with huber/transfer/treatment
AODA assess and follow through
mental health assess and follow through
110 days credit if revoked
$1347.99 in restitution to be paid to the clerk of courts, mother is victim, this is not a condition of probation 
DNA sample, surcharge

Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 02:30 pm
Telephone scheduling conference at 12-15-2015 08:00 am

Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; Def stands mute;   Court enters not guilty plea;  30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't. 15CM143 to track along.

w/15CF293: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $79.20 by next court date.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Defendant Caleb J Spoerl in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Vollan now notes that 15CM143 was also to be called - case not on the jail list; Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaints and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond - $1,000 Cash; Atty. Vollan response, heard on FTA at STC in 15CM143; Def.'s grandma heard - Def. will not be living with her; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 10/1/15 @ 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $1,000 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $79.20 by next court date.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
Notice of bond forfeiture

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: of bail bond forfeiture

Attorney Catherine Jane Terry appeared.  Attorney Yolanda Tienstra appears for the State of WIsconsin.  Defendant fails to appear, notice came back undeliverable, Atty Terry does not have any other address for the defendant.  Atty Terry has been unable to communicate with him.  State takes no position on the request to withdraw.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  Based on the failure to appear and failure to keep court notified, state requests warrant, court authorizes warrant.  Court removes the jury trial date.
Status conference at 07-31-2015 08:30 am
Jury trial on August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Continuance rec'd and sent up

(2:56) Defendant Caleb J Spoerl in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Terry heard - needs more time to reviews/discuss with client; JT remains; bond cont.
Restitution Summary
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Caleb J Spoerl in court, in custody via video from DCJ with attorney Greg E. Vollan (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
